reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband for a week in June 2011 and loved it. We stayed in a standard room, which would be quite small in some people's standards, however my husband and I found it to be cosy and comfortable. The bathroom had only a bath with a shower hose, which meant a sit down shower, as no shower screen, but we soon got used to this. Our room had no air conditioning, which you should bear in mind for the summer months. I guess if you are after space, then I would recommend booking a more superior room.
reviews.title: Cosy and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our French is not very good and found the staff, particularly Anne very helpful. Although, most people prefer it if you at least attempt French. By the end of our stay we were practically fluent!!!!
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel in a nice seaside town, with an excellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The grounds are lovely, with a central courtyard and a nice little pool, which I would imagine gets very busy in the summer. The restaurant is particularly nice, if a little expensive.
reviews.title: UGH!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort itself is nice, but was a bit quiet. I wonder if it gets busier later in the summer. The island itself is gorgeous and biking around the island was a pleasure.
reviews.title: Chic boutique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay, and I would recommend.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was everything we've expected. A good atmosphere and a good restaurant. We've been staying in the holiday season and the hotel was fully booked. Sometimes we've noticed that the staff couldn't handle the many requests from the guests - although they tried their utmost. This was mainly the case in the restaurant.
reviews.title: lovely setting, a bit crowded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms around the pool were good, but small. The little pool itself isn't suitable for big groups with children. The people that enjoy a relaxing swim are disturbed by kids playing, screaming and splashing water all over the place. It isn't the fault of the children: the pool is just to little for that many guests.
reviews.title: Lovely restaurant, shame about our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have recently returned from a lovely family holiday on Ile de Re. We stayed at this hotel and found the food to be of a very high standard and they were able to cater for both meat eaters and vegetarians alike. Certainly would recommend others to eat here.
reviews.title: overpriced and bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, we found the decor of our room to be slightly tired. Chipped paint, slight damp patch on ceiling. Although the rooms around the pool did appear to have been recently decorated.
reviews.title: We had a bad experience at this hotel and wouldn't stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you judge a book by the cover this hotel would be nice.
reviews.title: Charming hotel with superb restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Having read the reviews on Tripadvisor we were not disappointed. We booked a standard double room for one night which was clean, comfortable and quiet. It overlooked the courtyard and we sat out on the balcony area drinking Ile de Ré cognac and enjoying the sea air. We had a wonderful meal in the restaurant and the following day we walked off breakfast by strolling down to the market. We will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, fabulous food

likes.liked: — The food and the kittens in the courtyard
likes.disliked: — I would recommend SatNav for driving around Ile de Ré

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from L'Ocean yesterday and had a wondeful (if slightly wet!) stay. We booked a 'charme' category room and it was very nice - comfortable bed, separate toilet and shower, very nice shabby chic decor. Our shower was massive (a bit like a wet room really) and worked very well - was a bit worried about that after one of the other reviews!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

likes.liked: — The decor both in the room and the hotel generally, the location
likes.disliked: — The pricey breakfast and lack of kettle in the room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel grounds are very peaceful and almost art deco in decoration. The pool is quite small, but we got a sun lounger on the two sunny days we had, and it was lovely and quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The restaurant food was to die for, really delicious. I would agree with some comments that breakfast is rather expensive though - 10 euros for two croissants, tea, coffee, cereal, yogurt, cheese....it was nice, but not worth 10 euros. It was also a shame that there were no tea making facilities in the room - if nothing else, I had a stinking cold for the second half of our stay and was dying for some hot water to make a hot toddy before I went to bed!!!
reviews.title: LOVED, Loved loved!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, we loved it. The island is beautiful, the hotel is too, and set amidst proper French country streets. We will return!!
reviews.title: Chill out at Hotel l'Ocean .........

likes.liked: — Shabby chic decor, restaurant and location
likes.disliked: — Rooms backing on to the street can be a bit noisy with the windows open but not really a problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We received a very warm welcome at Hotel Ocean on Ile de Re. Although only a 2 star, the service was that of at least a 4 star. The rooms are very clean and individual., ours was very trendy. What makes this such a fantastic place to stay is the restaurant - as good if not better than most 5 star hotels we've stayed in!
reviews.title: A fab hotel with fantastic restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for four days in Hotel l'Ocean on the beautiful Ile de Ré. The air is so fresh and the sky so blue this is a really beautiful location - long sandy beaches, restaurants in all the right places and lovely roads for walking, cycling or driving.
reviews.title: Relaxing pretty hotel

likes.disliked: — Poor choice for conservative meat eaters on dinner menu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: Our room was charming and we could walk straight out on to an enclosed patio area. Perhaps when full this could be noisy but in May it is sunny, warm and peaceful.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, good food, a little impersonal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only downside for us was the dinner menu for table d'hote. While I love fish, my husband never eats it and this was a major feature on the menu each evening so he didn't do as well as I did foodwise. However, what he did eat was reasonable and all very well presented.
reviews.title: Perfect Hideaway with pretty indivdual rooms and great pool

likes.disliked: — Breakfast not worth the money - could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the Hotel l'Ocean in the narrow streets of Le Bois Plage- not an easy task I may say. And unloading your bags in the narrow streets before taking your car up to the public carpark 100m up the street was a bit fraught too. My room was on the first floor overlooking the little street at the side of the hotel, but it was dull, and I got the impression that the pictures on the web-site oversold the property a bit. Given that my room door was on a balcony above the bar's outdoor seating, I'd guess that it may not have been a quiet location at busier, dryer times of the year.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
